To build our reading comprehension app for children, we have selected several AWS services to provide a comprehensive and scalable solution. For content storage and delivery, we will use Amazon S3 and Amazon CloudFront respectively. These services offer fast and reliable delivery of large files, such as audio and video content, to a global audience. In addition, we will use Amazon Transcribe to transcribe audio content into text, enabling us to provide closed captioning and searchable content. To personalize content for each child, we will use Amazon Personalize, an AI/ML service that analyzes user behavior to recommend personalized content. We also considered using Amazon SageMaker to build our own recommendation engine, but opted for Personalize due to its ease of use and pre-built models.

To manage user authentication and authorization, we will use Amazon Cognito, which provides easy user sign-up, sign-in, and access control for mobile and web applications. To handle API requests from our application, we will use Amazon API Gateway to create and manage a RESTful API. This will allow us to easily manage and scale our API as our user base grows. For backend processing, we will use AWS Lambda, a serverless compute service that allows us to execute code in response to events. Lambda allows us to focus on the application logic instead of managing infrastructure. Finally, to monitor and analyze the performance of our application, we will use Amazon CloudWatch. CloudWatch provides a unified view of application and infrastructure metrics, logs, and alarms, allowing us to quickly identify and troubleshoot issues.
